intro: Filetia hirta, commonly known as the hairy filetia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Filetia hirta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
